verses.verse: (Trust in God under Adversity) A Psalm of David, when he fled from his son Absalom. O LORD, how many are my foes! Many are rising against me;
many are saying to me, “There is no help for you (Syr: Heb him) in God.” Selah
(Ps 27.6; 28.7) But you, O LORD, are a shield around me, my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.
(Ps 34.4; 99.9) I cry aloud to the LORD, and he answers me from his holy hill. Selah
(Lev 26.6; Ps 139.18) I lie down and sleep; I wake again, for the LORD sustains me.
I am not afraid of ten thousands of people who have set themselves against me all around.
Rise up, O LORD! Deliver me, O my God! For you strike all my enemies on the cheek; you break the teeth of the wicked.
(Num 6.23-27; Isa 43.11; Jer 3.23) Deliverance belongs to the LORD; may your blessing be on your people! Selah
